title: What is the main religion in Japan and China? - Quora

response.answer_text: About Japan, all I know is that they have their own religion called “Shintoism”, which has many sub-sects, some has been syncretized with Buddhism, which is also very popular there in Japan.    Some Buddhist sects in fact received its greatest development in Japan, such as the Nichiren sect and the Zen sect.     As for China, do you mean religion in PRC (People’s Republic of China) or religion of Chinese people all over the world? The PRC is a Communist country and does not have a main religion. Chinese people, however, has immigrated all over the world, and these overseas Chinese has various religions. Please refer to my previous answer here about the religion of Chinese people. Ben Haryo's answer to Do the Chinese have a religion and what god do they worship?

China is mainly Mahayana Buddhist, Taoist and Confucian.Japan is mainly Mahayana Buddhist,Shintoist,Taoist and Confucian,in both countries all those faiths listed are used practiced in a highly syncretic manner.Traditionally most people in Korea,Japan and China practice multiple faiths in a syncretic manner.
